SEARCH

Class JungleKing

java.lang.Object
JungleKing
public class JungleKing extends Object
JungleKing class is the main class that runs the Jungle King game. It initializes the game, sets up the board, and starts the game loop.

  • Field Details

    • player1

      public static Player player1

    • player2

      public static Player player2

  • Constructor Details

    • JungleKing

      public JungleKing()
      Constructor for the JungleKing class. Initializes the game, sets up the board, and starts the game loop.

  • Method Details

    • setupPossiblePositions

      public void setupPossiblePositions()
      Initializes possible positions for each player's pieces. Positions are shuffled to randomize the starting positions.

    • createPlayers

      public void createPlayers()
      Creates the players for the game.

    • createPieces

      public ArrayList<Piece> createPieces(ArrayList<int[]> positions)
      Creates the pieces for the players. Each piece is assigned a random position from the list of possible positions.
      Parameters:
      positions - The list of possible positions for the pieces.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of pieces with random positions.

    • showInitialPositions

      public void showInitialPositions()
      Displays the initial positions of the pieces on the board.

    • determineFirstPlayer

      public void determineFirstPlayer()
      Determines which player goes first based on the strength of the animal piece chosen. The player who chooses the animal with the higher strength goes first.

    • selectAnimal

      public int selectAnimal(Player player, ArrayList<int[]> positions)
      Allows the player to select an animal piece to determine the first player. The player selects a piece based on the available positions.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is selecting the animal piece.
      positions - The list of possible positions for the pieces.
      Returns:
      The strength of the selected animal piece, or 0 if not found.

    • getValidPosition

      public int[] getValidPosition(ArrayList<int[]> positions)
      Gets a valid position from the player. Ensures that the position entered by the player is valid.
      Parameters:
      positions - The list of possible positions for the pieces.
      Returns:
      The valid position entered by the player.

    • setupBoard

      public void setupBoard()
      Sets up the board with the players' pieces.

    • placePiecesOnBoard

      public void placePiecesOnBoard(Player player)
      Places the players' pieces on the board.
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose pieces are to be placed on the board.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game loop.

    • playTurn

      public void playTurn(Scanner scanner)
      Manage the player's turn. Displays the board, shows the current pieces, and processes the player's move.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner object to read input from the player.

    • selectPiece

      public Piece selectPiece(Scanner scanner)
      Allows the player to select a piece to move. The player selects a piece based on the available pieces.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner object to read input from the player.
      Returns:
      The selected piece, or null if not found.

    • validatePiece

      public Piece validatePiece(Piece piece)
      Validates the selected piece. If the piece is null, it is removed from the board.
      Parameters:
      piece - The selected piece to validate.
      Returns:
      The validated piece, or null if the piece is removed.

    • processPlayerMove

      public void processPlayerMove(Scanner scanner, Piece piece)
      Processes the player's move. The player enters a move (W/A/S/D) to move the piece on the board.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner object to read input from the player.
      piece - The selected piece to move.

    • checkWin

      public void checkWin(int x, int y)
      Checks if the current move is a winning move. If the move is a winning move, the game ends and the winner is declared.
      Parameters:
      x - The row position of the move.
      y - The column position of the move.

    • isWinningMove

      public static boolean isWinningMove(int x, int y, Player player, Board board)
      Checks if the current move is a winning move. A winning move is when the player reaches the opponent's base.
      Parameters:
      x - The row position of the move.
      y - The column position of the move.
      player - The player making the move.
      board - The game board.
      Returns:
      True if the move is a winning move, false otherwise.

    • switchTurn

      public void switchTurn()
      Switches the turn to the next player.
